org.gvsig.raster.wcs.io

Class WCSConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gvsig.raster.wcs.io.WCSConnector

  • public class WCSConnector
extends Object
    Connector between a WCS data provider and a WCSClient.

      • getDescription

        public String getDescription()

        Returns name and description of the server. It is supposed to be used as the source of the abstract field in your application's interface.

        Devuelve nombre y descripción (abstract) del servidor.

        Returns:
        String

        public WCSLayerNode[] getLayerList()
        Returns an array of WCSLayer's with the descriptors of all coverages

      • connect

        public boolean connect(boolean override,
              ICancellable cancel)
                throws IOException
        Establishes the connection to the WCS server. Connecting to a WCS is an abstraction.

        Actually, it sends a GetCapabilities and a general DescribeCoverage request (not a coverage-specific DescribeCoverage request) to read the necessary data for building further GetCoverage requests.

        Parameters:
        override -
        Throws:
        IOException.
        IOException

      • close

        public void close()
        No close operation is needed since WCS service it is a non-session based protocol. So, this does nothing and you can omit it.
